TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit FrameworkName extends System.Object implements class System.IEquatable`1<class System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName>

Docs.summary: Represents the name of a version of the .NET Framework.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string frameworkName) cil managed

Docs.param: A string that contains .NET Framework version information.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a string that contains information about a version of the .NET Framework.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.%23ctor%28System.String%29> constructor parses a string in the following format.
*identifier*, Version=*versionNumber*[, Profile=*profileName*]
Components in square brackets are optional. The following table describes each component.
|Component|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |*identifier*|An arbitrary string that identifies this <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName> instance.| |*versionNumber*|A string that represents the version of the .NET Framework, in the form [v]*major*.*minor*[.*build*.*revision*], where "v" can be either uppercase or lowercase, and the brackets denote optional elements of a version number.| |*profileName*|An arbitrary string that represents the profile of the .NET Framework version. Typically, it is used to denote some subset of the .NET Framework, such as the .NET Compact Framework or Silverlight.|
If both *versionNumber* and *profileName* are present, they can appear in any order after *identifier*. These strings are defined by the "Version" and "Profile" keywords, which are not case-sensitive.
The values of the *identifier*, *versionNumber*, and *profileName* components define the values of this <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName> object's properties as follows:
- Any leading or trailing white space in the *identifier* component is removed and the resulting string is assigned to the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Identifier%2A> property.
- Any leading or trailing white space and the initial "v" or "V", if present, are removed from the `versionNumber`. The returned string is then passed to the <xref:System.Version.%23ctor%28System.String%29?displayProperty=fullName> constructor, and the resulting <xref:System.Version?displayProperty=fullName> object is assigned to the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Version%2A> property.
- Any leading or trailing white space in the `profileName` component is removed and the resulting string is assigned to the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Profile%2A> property.
The following are examples of valid strings that can be passed to the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.%23ctor%2A> constructor:
- .NET Framework, Version=4.0
- .NETFramework, Version=4.0
- .NET Framework, Version=2.0, Profile=Compact
- .NET Framework, Version=v4.0, Profile=Compact
- .NET Framework, Profile=Full, Version=2.0.0

Docs.exception:
is .
-or-
has fewer than two components or more than three components.
-or-
does not include a major and minor version number.
-or-
does not include a valid version number.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string identifier, class System.Version version) cil managed

Docs.param: A string that identifies a .NET Framework version.
An object that contains .NET Framework version information.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a string and a object that identify a .NET Framework version.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName> class requires that a <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Version%2A> object include at least a major and minor version number.

MemberSignature.Value: public FrameworkName (string identifier, Version version, string profile);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string identifier, class System.Version version, string profile) cil managed

Docs.param: A string that identifies a .NET Framework version.
An object that contains .NET Framework version information.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a string, a object that identifies a .NET Framework version, and a profile name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName> class requires that a <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Version%2A> object include at least a major and minor version number.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Equals(object obj) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to compare to the current instance.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether this instance represents the same .NET Framework version as a specified object.
Docs.returns: if every component of the current object matches the corresponding component of ; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The method converts `obj` to a <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName> object and calls the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Equals%28System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName%29?displayProperty=fullName> overload to test for equality. If the conversion does not succeed or if `obj` is `null`, the method returns `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Equals(class System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName other) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to compare to the current instance.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether this instance represents the same .NET Framework version as a specified instance.
Docs.returns: if every component of the current object matches the corresponding component of ; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The method tests for equality by returning the result of the following comparisons:
- An ordinal comparison of the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Identifier%2A> property values of the current instance and `other`.
- An ordinal comparison of the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Profile%2A> property values of the current instance and `other`.
- A comparison of the version properties by calling the <xref:System.Version.Equals%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

Docs.summary: Gets the full name of this object.
Docs.value: The full name of this object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The string returned by the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.FullName%2A> property has the following format:
*identifier*, Version=*version*[, Profile=*profile*]
where *identifier* corresponds to the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Identifier%2A> property, `version` is equivalent to calling <xref:System.Version.ToString%2A?displayProperty=fullName> on the value of the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Version%2A> property, and `profile` corresponds to the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Profile%2A> property. If a profile has not been assigned to the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName> object, the profile component is not included in the string.
The value of the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.FullName%2A> property is identical to the string returned by the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.ToString%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool op_Equality (System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName left, System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName right);
.method public static hidebysig specialname bool op_Equality(class System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName left, class System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName right) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether two objects represent the same .NET Framework version.
Docs.returns: if the and parameters represent the same .NET Framework version; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.op_Equality%2A> method defines the operation of the equality operator for <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName> objects.
Languages that do not support custom operators can call the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Equals%28System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName%29?displayProperty=fullName> method instead.
## Examples The following example uses the equality operator to determine whether a <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName> object that represents the running version of the .NET Framework is equal to a supported version of the .NET Framework. Note that the two versions are not equal because they do not have identical version numbers.
[!code-csharp[System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Operators#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.versioning.frameworkname.operators/cs/Operators1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Operators#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.versioning.frameworkname.operators/vb/Operators1.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool op_Inequality (System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName left, System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName right);
.method public static hidebysig specialname bool op_Inequality(class System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName left, class System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName right) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether two objects represent different .NET Framework versions.
Docs.returns: if the and parameters represent different .NET Framework versions; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.op_Inequality%2A> method defines the operation of the inequality operator for <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName> objects.
Languages that do not support custom operators can test for inequality by calling the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Equals%28System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName%29?displayProperty=fullName> method and reversing its value.
## Examples The following example uses the equality operator to determine whether a <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName> object that represents the running version of the .NET Framework is equal to a supported version of the .NET Framework. Note that the two versions are not equal because they do not have identical version numbers.
[!code-csharp[System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Operators#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.versioning.frameworkname.operators/cs/Operators1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Operators#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.versioning.frameworkname.operators/vb/Operators1.vb#2)]

Docs.value: The profile name of this object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of the read-only <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Profile%2A> property is set in the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.%23ctor%2A> class constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the string representation of this object.
Docs.returns: A string that represents this object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The string returned by the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.ToString%2A> method has the following format:
*identifier*, Version=*version*[, Profile=*profile*]
where *identifier* corresponds to the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Identifier%2A> property, `version` is equivalent to calling <xref:System.Version.ToString%2A?displayProperty=fullName> on the value of the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Version%2A> property, and `profile` corresponds to the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Profile%2A> property. If a profile has not been assigned to the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName> object, the profile component is not included in the returned string.
The value returned by the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.ToString%2A> method is identical to the value of the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.FullName%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets the version of this object.
Docs.value: An object that contains version information about this object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of the read-only <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.Version%2A> property is set in the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName.%23ctor%2A> class constructor.
